lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Monkey.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Monkey.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
tasks = storage.loadTasks();  // Load tasks from file
// Adds a task: todo, deadline, or event based on input
public void addTask(String input) throws MonkeyException {
throw new MonkeyException("Oh no! The description of a " + parts[0] + " cannot be empty.");
throw new MonkeyException("Oh no! Deadlines must have the format: deadline <task> /by <date>");
throw new MonkeyException("Oh no! Events must have the format: event <task> /from <start> /to <end>");
throw new MonkeyException("Oh no! This command is invalid.");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list: ");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: ");
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: ");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Oh no! I do not understand the command.");
System.out.println("Oh no! The task number is invalid.");
return tasks; // No file yet, return empty list
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
return "[E]" + "[" + getStatusIcon() + "] " + description + " (from: " + from + " to: " + to + ")";
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
